qas.question: Along with geothermal and nuclear, what is a notable non-combustion heat source?

answers.text: solar power, nuclear power or geothermal energy

qas.question: What ideal thermodynamic cycle analyzes the process by which steam engines work?
In the Rankine cycle, what does water turn into when heated?
At what pressure is water heated in the Rankine cycle?
What types of engines are steam engines?
Along with geothermal and nuclear, what is a notable combustion heat source?
What ideal thermodynamic cycle analyzes the process by which solar engines work?
In the Rankine cycle, what does nuclear power turn into when heated?
At what pressure is nuclear power heated in the Rankine cycle?
What types of engines are solar engines?

context: Steam engines are <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3><b9_0>external combustion<b9_0/><a4_3/><a4_1/><a4_0/> engines<a4_2/>, where the working fluid is separate from the combustion products. Non-combustion heat sources such as <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0>solar<b5_0/><a0_3/><a0_0/> power<a0_1/>, nuclear power or geothermal energy<a0_2/> may be used. The ideal thermodynamic cycle used to analyze this process is called the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2><a1_3><b6_0>Rankine<b6_0/><a1_0/> cycle<a1_3/><a1_2/><a1_1/>. In the cycle, water is heated and transforms into <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3><b7_0>steam<b7_0/><a2_3/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> within a boiler operating at a <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3><b8_0>high<b8_0/><a3_3/><a3_1/><a3_0/> pressure<a3_2/>. When expanded through pistons or turbines, mechanical work is done. The reduced-pressure steam is then condensed and pumped back into the boiler.
